definition: to worship/to make customary deferences to/a pilgrimage
abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards
morning
to pay respect/worship/visit/salute
a pilgrimage to a holy mountain

sentences.english: The climactic battle to kill the false being within and victoriously conclude the spiritual pilgrimage.
sentences.chinese: 一场和自身错误战斗的高潮，精神朝拜的胜利终止。

sentences.english: Thou art the All-pervading Spirit, but I have made pilgrimages to sacred places.
sentences.chinese: 你是遍及所有的精神，但我却朝拜圣地。

sentences.english: And they ate of them, and adored their gods.
sentences.chinese: 民众吃了供物，且朝拜了她们的神祇。

sentences.english: In London pilgert man zur Queen.
sentences.chinese: 在伦敦，人们可以去朝拜女皇。

sentences.english: Prayer and praising all men raising, Worship Him, God on high.
sentences.chinese: 愿万人来祷告颂赞，朝拜真神在天。

sentences.english: Temple was very small, but people from all the directions went there and kowtowed to the deities.
sentences.chinese: 庙虽小，但来四面八方的人们都来这儿向神灵朝拜。

sentences.english: Here is the snow-capped mountains where the sun worship.
sentences.chinese: 这里是雪山朝拜太阳的地方。

sentences.english: I can’t wait to worship the Lord!
sentences.chinese: 我迫不及待想朝拜上帝。

sentences.english: The faithful believers are never seen before at Putuo Mount.
sentences.chinese: 普陀山上看到虔诚的信徒集体朝拜。

sentences.english: "It would", says Mr Lin, "be the heavenly dynasty all over again, and the barbarians coming to worship.
sentences.chinese: 中国将重新成为天朝圣国，野蛮邻人对其敬仰朝拜。

sentences.english: Many Tibetan travels thousands of miles pilgrimaging to Tsedrug each year.
sentences.chinese: 每年都有许多藏民不远千里前来绕山朝拜。

sentences.english: The mountain became a sacred place for pilgrims from all over the country.
sentences.chinese: 峨嵋一直是来自全国朝拜者的圣地。

sentences.english: The Roman temple was fashioned with space for worshipers outside in a courtyard.
sentences.chinese: 罗马式样则流行在神庙外面的院子里让朝拜者祭祀。

sentences.english: Also at midnight, all the sheep in the fields turn and bow towards the East.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞夜的午夜时分地里所有的羊都向着东方朝拜。

sentences.english: As the ancestral temple, every day a quantity of believers come there.
sentences.chinese: 作为祖庙，每天来此朝拜妈祖的香客非常多。

sentences.english: Many people made their pilgrimage in groups, wearing black or brown robes and shoulder bags.
sentences.chinese: 许多人集体上山朝拜，穿着黑袍或棕袍，挎着挎包。

definition: to formally call on/to worship (a God)/to pay homage to sb
to give audience (of emperor)/retainers' duty to pay respect to sovereign/hajj (Islam)
to kowtow/to kneel and worship
to bow in salute/to kowtow
to make a pilgrimage
to pay a formal visit/to call to pay respects/to pay homage (at a monument, mausoleum etc)
pilgrim
believers/worshippers
to burn incense at a temple
to kneel and bow with joined hands at forehead level/to worship
to offer sacrifice (to one's ancestors)
to consecrate/to enshrine and worship/an offering (to one's ancestors)/a sacrifice (to a God)
to worship piously/to present/to dedicate
to worship/to observe religious rites/to pay one's respects (to one's ancestors etc)
to revere/to admire
to kneel three times and kowtow nine times (formal etiquette on meeting the emperor)
